profileAlternative.name: Daveed Vandevoorde
profileAlternative.headline: VP of Engineering at Edison Design Group, Inc.
profileAlternative.summary:
My professional career has centered around the C++ programming language. I'm known for being one of the three people who implemented the ill-fated "export" feature, as well as being the principal author of "C++ Templates -- The Complete Guide". I'm also a co-founder of comp.lang.c++.moderated (for a long time, the #1 on-line forum for the discussion of C++ programming), and a very active participant in the C++ standardization process (where I'm currently one of the five members of the "direction group").

Besides my professional interest in C++, I'm also quite fond of solving more general algorithmic problems. I invented the optimal "maximum rectangle algorithm" ("find the largest uniform rectangle of 1s in a rectangular array of 0s and 1s"), pioneered some approaches to image restoration using incomplete/incorrect boundary data, and wrote a doctoral dissertation introducing an efficient rank-revealing factoring of Hankel matrices (with various applications in signal processing).

I get daily requests for adding people to my "LinkedIn network", but I prefer to limit connections to people I actually have an acquaintance with. If we've met face-to-face or we've had a significant on-line discussion, I'll be happy to link up. Otherwise, let's do so first...

positions.title: VP of Engineering
positions.description: I work on most aspects of the C++ front end. Recent work includes the implementation of various C++17 features like "class template argument deduction" and "fold expressions".

positions.title: Technical Expert
positions.description: I designed and wrote the specifications of various C++ language extensions (e.g., user-defined literals). I also contribute to fixing various defects in the specification. Lately, I've been part of the "direction group" of the C++ standardization committee: A small group (currently 5 people) of long-standing experts trying to provide some general direction for the evolution of that language.

positions.title: Software Design Engineer
positions.description: Tech Lead of HP-UX C++ compiler (aCC) development team.
